alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Bedford; Botetourt (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 1:01AM EDT until July 14 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia, south central Virginia and west central Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Amherst. In south central Virginia, Bedford. In west central Virginia, Botetourt and Rockbridge. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 101 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Back Creek, Davidson Run, Dry Branch, Beckner Branch, Back Run, Cornelius Creek, David Run, Curry Creek, Catawba Creek, Big Hollow Branch and Buck Branch. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buchanan... Glasgow... Big Island... Fincastle... Arcadia... Natural Bridge... Springwood... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
